intro: Calyptranthes conduplicata, commonly known as the double-leaf calyptranthes, is a species of flowering plant in the family Myrtaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its opposite, elliptic to ovate leaves that are often pubescent on the underside. It produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which are followed by small, berry-like fruits. Calyptranthes conduplicata is typically found in moist, shaded habitats such as montane forests.
